headline: Weekly market outlook: assessing the debt limit deal
content:
WEEKLY MARKET
Assessing the Debt Limit Deal
OUTLOOK
President Biden and House Speaker
JUNE 1, 2023
Kevin McCarthy announced over the Table of Contents
Memorial Day Weekend an agreement

in principle to limit federal spending and
Dante DeAntonio suspend the debt limit. The House of

Fiscal Responsibility Act, which now

from the White House. CDS Movers ..................................... 17

Steven Shields
caps on the federal discretionary budget
Latin America that the bill imposes for fiscal 2024 and 2025. Under the bill, nondefense spending is to
remain roughly flat in fiscal 2024 and then increase by 1% in fiscal 2025. Meanwhile, the
Darrah Peklak defense budget will grow by 3% in fiscal 2024, which would be consistent with Biden’s
Juan Pablo Fuentes
request in his fiscal 2024 budget proposal. However, the Fiscal Responsibility Act limits
Alfredo Coutino
growth in the military spending budget to 1% in fiscal 2025.
Inside Economics Podcast:
Besides the caps on discretionary spending, the debt limit deal takes away some of the
IRS funding that Democrats had included in the Inflation Reduction Act. The Fiscal
Responsibility Act will tighten work requirements for certain recipients of government
social benefits through the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program and the
Temporary Assistance for Needy Families program. In particular, the deal expands work
requirements for childless adults aged 50 to 54 receiving food stamps through SNAP.
Under current law, those work requirements apply only to childless, able-bodied adults
aged 18 to 49.
Join the Conversation
The bill addresses pandemic-era policies, most notably it ends the current freeze on
Apple Podcasts student loan repayments. Student loan forbearance, in place since the onset of the
Google Podcasts

Moody’s Analytics does not provide investment advisory services or products. For further detail, please see the last page.
